data.sampled: : Correct. The answer is d) Roux en Y Duodenal Bypass. This is a common surgical treatment for morbid obesity which involves rerouting the small intestine into a much smaller stomach pouch, limiting the amount of food which can be consumed in a single meal. Adjustable gastric banding and biliopancreatic diversion are other surgical options, but both have significant potential risks and should generally be avoided whenever possible.<|im_end|>

options: d) Roux en Y Duodenal By pass

data.sampled: d) All are equal. The mean and median are both measures of the central tendency of a dataset, but they differ in their behavior with respect to skewness. The mean is strongly influenced by the tail of the distribution, while the median is more robust to outliers. Therefore, if there are no outliers or a symmetric distribution, the mean and median will be equal. However, if there are outliers or a skewed distribution, the median will be a better measure of central tendency than the mean.<|im_end|>

Subject: Medicine

Which of the following statements are True/False? 1. Hirsutism, which is defined as androgen-dependent excessive male pattern hair growth, affects approximately 25% of women. 2. Virilization refers to a condition in which androgen levels are sufficiently high to cause additional signs and symptoms. 3. Frequently, patients with growth hormone excess (i.e., acromegaly) present with hirsutism. 4. A simple and commonly used method to grade hair growth is the modified scale of Ferriman and Gallwey. 5. Scores above 8 suggest excess androgen-mediated hair growth.

a) 1, 2, 3 True & 4, 5 false
b) 1, 3, 5 True & 2, 4 false
c) 2, 4, 5 True & 1, 3 false
d) 1, 2, 3, 4 True & 5 false

data.sampled:
: d) Atypical vessels. 

The abnormal vascular patterns seen with colposcopy in case of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia (CIN) are known as "vascular patterns". These include punctation (small blood vessels), mosaicism (clusters of abnormal cells), "satellite lesions" (small, round areas of abnormal cells) and atypical vessels (large blood vessels that are not normal). "Punctation" refers to small blood vessels that are present in the tissue of the cervix, which is usually the most common type of vascular pattern seen. "Mosaicism" refers to clusters of abnormal cells mixed in with normal cells, while "satellite lesions" are small, round areas of abnormal cells adjacent to normal cervical tissue. Finally, "atypical vessels" are large blood vessels that are present in the tissues of the cervix but do not conform to normal vessel patterns.<|im_end|>
